result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Douglas G Griffin

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Douglas G Griffin in court with attorney Eryn M Menden.  Shawn N Woller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Charges dismissed and Read-in to: 15CF944.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection and Notice of Intent to Use Defendant's Statement and DNA Evidence. Witness list attached.
Jury trial - 12 person on May 17, 2016 at 08:15 am.
Jury status hearing on May 12, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Douglas G Griffin in court by telephone with attorney Eryn M Menden.  Abbey Nickolie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The Court addresses the negative WCS report and reminds the Defendant it will not tolerate any further non compliance with WCS.   Attorney Menden is requesting an adjournment of today's hearing as the parties are still in negotations.  The Court schedules 16CF42 for trial and 15CF944 to tag along.  Jury status hearing scheduled for May 12, 2016 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for May 17, 2016 at 08:15 am.

Defendant Douglas G Griffin in court with attorney Eryn M Menden.  Brian J. Juech appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The Defendant waives his right to a preliminary hearing.   The Defendant is bound over for trial.    NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  An information is filed and Attorney Menden waives the right for a reading. Defendant Douglas G Griffin in court with attorney Eryn M Menden.  Brian J. Juech appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Menden requests an adjournment of the plea hearing as the the parties are still in negotiations but the Defendant will not be pursuing Drug Treatment Court.     The Court addresses the negative WCS report.  The Defendant is to go to his primary physician for any further prescriptions and to advise the physician of the pending charges.    The State takes no position on bond.  Bail remains as set and the Court reminds the Defendant the importance of remaining in compliance with WCS.  Attorney Menden requests the Court set the matter for plea and sentencing.
Defendant to have no contact with victims listed in the Criminal Complaint or their residences.

Defendant Douglas G Griffin in court, in custody, with attorney Jorge R Fragoso for Attorney Eryn Menden.   Melissa Zilavy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.  Hearing scheduled for February 3, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Waukesha County Pretrial Screening Services Report by Wisconsin Community Services filed.
